clinical_study.official_title: Safety of Lumbar Spine Radiofrequency Procedures in the Presence of Posterior Pedicle Screws: A Prospective Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of the study is to determine if patients undergoing radiofrequency neurotomy of lumbar facet joints that are adjacent to previously placed pedical screws from a fusion, will lead to an increase in the temperature of the pedical screws.

primary_outcome.measure: Measure the temperature of adjacent pedicle screws during radiofrequency ablation procedure
primary_outcome.description: The aim of the study is to show that the temperature of pedical screws increase during radiofrequecy neurotomy of lumbar facet joints that are adjacent to them. If so, the overall goal is to be able to counsel patients on the potential risk that radiofrequency neurotomy (RFN) will result in tissue damage surrounding their hardware.

clinical_study.condition: Radiofrequency Ablation in Patients With Spinal Hardware

arm_group.description: Temperature probe placement will be performed for all patients

intervention.description: Patients with spinal hardware that are undergoing radiofrequency ablation procedures will have an addtional radiofrequency cannula placed at the site of adjacent pedicle screws for temperature measurment only.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Scheduled for Radiofrequency procedure AND has spinal hardware placed from a previous spinal surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- 1) Active infection over skin where needle will be placed 2) Coagulopathy 3) Preganancy
